definition: to get out of the way/to step aside
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: You must wait for M/V Chang Geng clear entrance before leaving berth.
sentences.chinese: 在離泊前你船必須等“長庚”船讓開入口。

sentences.english: Rescue boat assisting No. 1 lifeboat standing clear of vessel now.
sentences.chinese: 營救船正在幫助1號救生艇讓開母船。

sentences.english: Soon get out of the way of the road is surrounded close windtight gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 很快讓開的那條道路又被混混們圍得密不透風。

sentences.english: Guys, please step away if you're not in the shot.
sentences.chinese: 各位，如果你不需要拍攝這個鏡頭，請讓開。

sentences.english: That dark western dress man immediately treads aside body and have no the slightest hesitant.
sentences.chinese: 那黑西裝男人立刻讓開身體，沒有絲毫猶豫。

sentences.english: Don't bother to move I think I can just brush past.
sentences.chinese: 用不着讓開，我想我剛好能過得去。

sentences.english: Her skirt was soon smeared with mud from passing cars .
sentences.chinese: 她的裙子讓開過去的汽車給濺上了泥巴。

sentences.english: However, as the plate moves over it, a line of volcanoes is formed.
sentences.chinese: 然而，當板塊讓開它，一系列的火上就形成了。

sentences.english: The runner had already moved to the side, but her tattered waistcoat was not done up.
sentences.chinese: 車伕已經讓開道，但伊的破棉背心沒有上扣。

sentences.english: You can't get out of the way, you can't dig a hole deep enough to hide.
sentences.chinese: 你不能讓開，你不能挖個洞深足夠的藏身之地。

sentences.english: The crowd made way for him.
sentences.chinese: 圍觀人羣給他讓開一條路。

definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
